thread.title: Manziel stopped by police after argument with girlfriend

title: Manziel stopped by police after argument with girlfriend
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Manziel stopped by police after argument with girlfriend Witnesses said he was driving fast on the shoulder trying to pass another vehicle as he was trying to pull his girlfriend back into the vehicle. Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Manziel stopped by police after argument with girlfriend Michelle Homer / KHOU.com staff 8:03 p.m. EDT October 16, 2015 ARLINGTON, TX - SEPTEMBER 27: Johnny Manziel #2 of the Cleveland Browns reacts after receiving his Aggie Ring during half time of the Southwest Classic at AT&T Stadium on September 27, 2014 in Arlington, Texas. (Photo by Tom Pennington/Getty Images) (Photo: Tom Pennington, Getty Images) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
HOUSTON â€“ Johnny Manziel is in trouble again. 
The former Aggie star quarterback, who now plays for the Cleveland Browns, was stopped by police Monday in Avon, Ohio. 
Witnesses said he was driving at a high speed on the shoulder trying to pass another vehicle. 
They say Manziel's girlfriend, Colleen Crowley, was trying to get out of the vehicle and he pulled her back in. 
When police pulled them over, Manziel admitted they'd been drinking earlier in the day. 
Manziel said Crowley got back because he had her cell phone in the car so she threw his wallet out the window. 
Crowley told the officer that Manziel had pushed her head into the car window, but she didn't want to press charges. 
His girlfriend posted an apology on Instagram: 
Coll Crowley posted an apology on Instagram. (Photo: Instagram) 
The officer said he smelled alcohol on Manziel's breath but that he didn't appear to be intoxicated. The officer said Crowley had bloodshot eyes, slurred speech and did appear intoxicated. 
Crowley cursed at the officer and stated: "I didn't do anything wrong and my dad's a lawyer." 
Police eventually released them both without charges. 
The couple has been living together for two months, but Crowley said she is returning to Texas soon to finish her senior year at TCU. 
Crowley later posted on Instagram: "J and I are good. I appreciate the people who stopped to check on us and call the police. I could see how it may have looked... Fortunately, it was just an argument, it was private and we are all good." YOU MAY ALSO LIKE...
